## Vignette Info
This example comes from the textbook section 7.15.2 (p 382-384).

```{r load}
library(permuter)
source("../R/t2p.r")
data(waterfalls)

 


```

```{r analysis}
B <- 500
attach(waterfalls)

data <- waterfalls[, -c(1, 2)]
L <- unique(Panelist)
l <- length(L)
n <- dim(data)[1]
p <- dim(data)[2]
C <- n/l

D <- array(0, dim = c(C, p, l))

for (j in 1:l) {
    D[, , j] <- as.matrix(data[Panelist == j, ])
}

DD <- D  # auxiliary

for (i in 1:l) {
    for (j in 1:C) {
        DD[j, , i] <- D[j, , i] - D[1, , i]
    }
}

D <- DD[-1, , ]

T <- array(0, dim = c((B + 1), p, (C - 1)))

for (j in 1:(C - 1)) {
    T[1, , ] <- t(apply(D, c(1, 2), sum))
}

for (bb in 2:(B + 1)) {
    D.star <- D
    for (j in 1:l) {
        S.star <- 1 - 2 * rbinom((C - 1), 1, 0.5)
        D.star[, , j] <- D[, , j] * S.star
    }
    for (j in 1:(C - 1)) {
        T[bb, , ] <- t(apply(D.star, c(1, 2), sum))
    }
}

P <- t2p_old(T)
partial.p <- P[1, , ]
rownames(partial.p) <- colnames(data)
colnames(partial.p) <- c("s-r", "t-r", "v-r", "w-r", "x-r")

partial.p

 


```

## Domains
```{r domains}
dom <- rep(c(1:5), each = 3)
T.dom <- array(0, dim = c((B + 1), 5, 5))

for (d in 1:5) {
    T.dom[, d, ] <- apply(P[, dom == d, ], c(1, 3), function(x) {
        -2 * log(prod(x))
    })
}

P.dom <- t2p_old(T.dom)
res <- P.dom[1, , ]
rownames(res) <- c("Bloom", "Dry", "Long", "Neat", "Wet")
colnames(res) <- c("r-s", "r-t", "r-v", "r-w", "r-x")
res

 


```
